newsitem.title: USA: Autoliv's Bark to become Autoliv Inc CEO.
newsitem.headline: Autoliv's Bark to become Autoliv Inc CEO.

text.p: Autoliv Inc, the company resulting from the pending combination of Autoliv AB and Morton International Inc, on Tuesday reported changes in its management structure.
Gunnar Bark, chairman of the board of Autoliv AB, will take on the additional title of chief executive officer in addition to serving as chairman of Autoliv Inc.
Fred Musone, president of Morton's automotive safety products business, will serve Autoliv in the capacity of chief operating officer as well as a director.

A special meeting of Morton's shareholders to vote on the pending combination, as well as the spinoff of Morton's specialty chemicals and salt businesses to Morton's shareholders, will be held April 24.
The acceptance period for the pending exchange offer by Autoliv Inc for the shares of Autoliv AB is scheduled to be completed on the same day.
